algorithm_technique: Use a Trie to efficiently find all occurrences of keywords and mark them for bolding.
Iterate through the string and use string searching (e.g., find) to mark keyword occurrences.
problem_summary_simple: Bold all occurrences of keywords in a string, merging overlapping bolded sections.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a Trie or string searching to identify all substrings matching keywords, then merges overlapping intervals to apply bold tags minimally.
key_insights: The problem requires identifying all substrings that match any of the given words.
A Trie is an efficient data structure for searching multiple patterns simultaneously.
After marking all occurrences, merging overlapping intervals is key to minimizing tags.
A simpler approach involves iterating through each word and finding its occurrences in the string.
A boolean array can track which characters should be bolded.
Merging consecutive bolded segments is necessary to produce the minimal tag output.
